BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Fresh wind slabs require caution. In addition the danger of dry and wet avalanches will increase as the day progresses.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
The surface of the snowpack will only just freeze and will already soften in the late morning. The fresh snow and in particular the sometimes deep wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant and generally at intermediate and high altitudes. These are to be found especially in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain.
In particular in the regions with a lot of snow more medium-sized and large moist and wet avalanches are possible as a consequence of warming. The wind slabs of the weekend will become increasingly prone to triggering in particular on steep sunny slopes.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
In some places new snow and wind slabs are lying on the smooth surface of an old snowpack. This applies in particular at intermediate and high altitudes and along the border with Switzerland.
In some cases the wind slabs have bonded poorly with the old snowpack.
Sunny slopes: As a consequence of rising temperatures and solar radiation a crust formed on the surface.
The new snow of the weekend has settled to a large extent in particular on steep sunny slopes.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: The meteorological conditions will facilitate a slow strengthening of the snowpack.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Fresh wind slabs require caution. In addition the danger of dry and wet avalanches will increase as the day progresses.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
The surface of the snowpack will only just freeze and will already soften in the late morning. The fresh snow and in particular the sometimes deep wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant and generally at intermediate and high altitudes. These are to be found especially in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain.
In particular in the regions with a lot of snow more medium-sized and large moist and wet avalanches are possible as a consequence of warming. The wind slabs of the weekend will become increasingly prone to triggering in particular on steep sunny slopes.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
In some places new snow and wind slabs are lying on the smooth surface of an old snowpack. This applies in particular at intermediate and high altitudes and along the border with Switzerland.
In some cases the wind slabs have bonded poorly with the old snowpack.
Sunny slopes: As a consequence of rising temperatures and solar radiation a crust formed on the surface.
The new snow of the weekend has settled to a large extent in particular on steep sunny slopes.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: The meteorological conditions will facilitate a slow strengthening of the snowpack.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: As a consequence of warming more moist and wet avalanches are possible, even medium-sized ones.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
The danger of moist and wet avalanches will increase during the day. In localities where the night is overcast the danger will increase earlier.
In particular intermediate and high altitudes very steep sunny slopes: As a consequence of warming during the day there will be an additional increase in the danger of moist and wet avalanches. The peak danger point will be reached from the middle of the day probably. Small and medium-sized moist and wet avalanches are possible below approximately 3000 m, in particular at the base of rock walls.

Since Sunday the wind has been moderate to strong in particular along the border with France and along the border with Switzerland. Here rather small wind slabs formed.
The visible wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant in some cases. As the moisture increases the avalanche prone locations will become more prevalent. These avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas and in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
The new snow of the weekend has settled to a large extent in particular on steep sunny slopes.
Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to rapid moistening of the snowpack over a wide area in particular on very steep sunny slopes below approximately 3000 m.
The new snow and wind slabs are lying on the unfavourable surface of an old snowpack on rather lightly snow-covered shady slopes. Is lying on a crust on steep south, west and southeast facing slopes.
In some cases the wind slabs have bonded still only poorly with the old snowpack.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: As a consequence of falling temperatures, the natural avalanche activity will rapidly decrease.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation more moist and wet avalanches are to be expected.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
The new snow and wind slabs of the weekend can be released naturally especially on steep sunny slopes. As a consequence of warming during the day, the likelihood of moist and wet avalanches being released will increase. Field observations and artificially triggered avalanches confirm this situation.
The wind slabs of the weekend are to be evaluated with care and prudence in particular in very steep terrain. In particular gullies and bowls as well as places that are protected from the wind: The fresh wind slabs can in some cases be released, even by a single winter sport participant and reach medium size.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
In some places new snow and wind slabs are lying on the smooth surface of an old snowpack. This applies especially at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions.
The weather conditions will give rise to increasing moistening of the snowpack on sunny slopes. Sunny slopes: As a consequence of sharply rising temperatures and partly cloudy skies a crust will form on the surface during the next few days.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: These conditions will facilitate a gradual strengthening of the snowpack.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The avalanche danger will increase a little during the day.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
The more recent wind slabs of the weekend must be evaluated with care and prudence. In particular gullies and bowls as well as places that are protected from the wind: These can in some cases be released by a single winter sport participant.
In particular on steep sunny slopes more dry and moist avalanches are possible as a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation. In the regions exposed to heavier precipitation more avalanches are possible as the day progresses, in particular medium-sized ones.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
In some places new snow and wind slabs are lying on the smooth surface of an old snowpack. This applies especially at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions, along the border with France.
Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise from early morning to rapid moistening of the snowpack on sunny slopes. Sunny slopes: As a consequence of sharply rising temperatures and solar radiation a crust formed on the surface during the last few days.
In localities where the night is overcast the danger will increase earlier.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: As a consequence of falling temperatures, the natural avalanche activity will appreciably decrease.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: As a consequence of warming, the natural avalanche activity will gradually increase.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Outgoing longwave radiation during the night will be quite good. As a consequence of warming during the day, the likelihood of natural wet avalanches being released will increase gradually in particular on steep southeast and southwest facing slopes at intermediate altitudes.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise from late morning to a loss of strength within the snowpack over a wide area in particular on steep sunny slopes above approximately 1600 m.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: As a consequence of warming, the natural avalanche activity will gradually increase.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Outgoing longwave radiation during the night will be quite good. As a consequence of warming during the day, the likelihood of natural wet avalanches being released will increase gradually in particular on steep southeast and southwest facing slopes at intermediate altitudes.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise from late morning to a loss of strength within the snowpack over a wide area in particular on steep sunny slopes above approximately 1600 m.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: As a consequence of warming and solar radiation, the activity of moist avalanches will appreciably increase. Old wind slabs are to be evaluated with care and prudence.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation moist snow slides and avalanches are possible as the day progresses. Avalanche prone locations for moist avalanches are to be found on steep southeast, south and west facing slopes. This applies in particular on steep slopes below approximately 2600 m, as well as on rocky sunny slopes at elevated altitudes. Mostly avalanches are only small but in many cases easily released.
The old wind slabs can be released even by a single winter sport participant. In isolated cases the avalanches are medium-sized. The avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular on steep slopes above approximately 2200 m, and in gullies and bowls.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to softening of the snowpack over a wide area in particular on sunny slopes below approximately 2800 m.
The old wind slabs are poorly bonded with the old snowpack in particular on steep shady slopes and at elevated altitudes.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to moistening of the snowpack over a wide area. As a consequence of warming numerous moist and wet avalanches are to be expected, even medium-sized ones.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: As a consequence of warming and solar radiation, the activity of moist avalanches will appreciably increase. Old wind slabs are to be evaluated with care and prudence.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation moist snow slides and avalanches are possible as the day progresses. Avalanche prone locations for moist avalanches are to be found on steep southeast, south and west facing slopes. This applies in particular on steep slopes below approximately 2600 m, as well as on rocky sunny slopes at elevated altitudes. Mostly avalanches are only small but in many cases easily released.
The old wind slabs can be released even by a single winter sport participant. In isolated cases the avalanches are medium-sized. The avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular on steep slopes above approximately 2200 m, and in gullies and bowls.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to softening of the snowpack over a wide area in particular on sunny slopes below approximately 2800 m.
The old wind slabs are poorly bonded with the old snowpack in particular on steep shady slopes and at elevated altitudes.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to moistening of the snowpack over a wide area. As a consequence of warming numerous moist and wet avalanches are to be expected, even medium-sized ones.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: As a consequence of warming, the natural avalanche activity will gradually increase.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Outgoing longwave radiation during the night will be quite good. As a consequence of warming during the day, the likelihood of natural wet avalanches being released will increase gradually in particular on steep southeast and southwest facing slopes at intermediate altitudes.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise from late morning to a loss of strength within the snowpack over a wide area in particular on steep sunny slopes above approximately 1600 m.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: As a consequence of warming, the natural avalanche activity will gradually increase.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Outgoing longwave radiation during the night will be quite good. As a consequence of warming during the day, the likelihood of natural wet avalanches being released will increase gradually in particular on steep southeast and southwest facing slopes at intermediate altitudes.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise from late morning to a loss of strength within the snowpack over a wide area in particular on steep sunny slopes above approximately 1600 m.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Wind slabs require caution. As the day progresses wet snow slides are to be expected.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
The fresh and somewhat older wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant in isolated cases in particular on steep shady slopes. Avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls. At elevated altitudes and in the regions exposed to heavier precipitation such avalanche prone locations are a little more prevalent. In some cases avalanches are medium-sized.

As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation mostly small moist snow slides are to be expected below approximately 2600 m. This applies in particular on steep sunny slopes.

Individual gliding avalanches are possible, even medium-sized ones. Areas with glide cracks are to be avoided.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
The wind slabs are lying on soft layers on shady slopes at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions.

Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to increasing softening of the snowpack over a wide area in particular on steep sunny slopes. These conditions will cause a weakening of the near-surface layers as the day progresses.

Towards its base, the snowpack consists of faceted crystals but is hard to trigger.

At low and intermediate altitudes only a little snow is lying.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Wind slabs require caution. As the day progresses wet snow slides are to be expected.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Wind slabs require caution. As the day progresses wet snow slides are to be expected.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
The fresh and somewhat older wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant in isolated cases in particular on steep shady slopes. Avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls. At elevated altitudes and in the regions exposed to heavier precipitation such avalanche prone locations are a little more prevalent. In some cases avalanches are medium-sized.

As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation mostly small moist snow slides are to be expected below approximately 2600 m. This applies in particular on steep sunny slopes.

Individual gliding avalanches are possible, even medium-sized ones. Areas with glide cracks are to be avoided.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
The wind slabs are lying on soft layers on shady slopes at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions.

Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to increasing softening of the snowpack over a wide area in particular on steep sunny slopes. These conditions will cause a weakening of the near-surface layers as the day progresses.

Towards its base, the snowpack consists of faceted crystals but is hard to trigger.

At low and intermediate altitudes only a little snow is lying.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Wind slabs require caution. As the day progresses wet snow slides are to be expected.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: As a consequence of warming more moist and wet avalanches are possible.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
The danger of moist and wet avalanches will increase during the day. In localities where the night is overcast the danger will increase earlier.
Intermediate and high altitudes very steep sunny slopes: As a consequence of warming during the day there will be an additional increase in the danger of moist and wet avalanches. The peak danger point will be reached from the middle of the day probably. Small and, in isolated cases, medium-sized moist and wet avalanches are possible below approximately 3000 m, in particular at the base of rock walls.

Since Sunday the wind has been strong in some localities in some regions. Particularly in the valley heads.
The mostly small wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant in some cases in particular on very steep shady slopes above approximately 2500 m. These avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas and in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
The new snow of the weekend has settled to a large extent in particular on steep sunny slopes.
In many places new snow is being deposited on bare ground, now resurfaced (--), especially on sunny slopes and at low and intermediate altitudes.
Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to rapid moistening of the snowpack over a wide area in particular on very steep sunny slopes below approximately 3000 m.
The new snow and wind slabs of the weekend are lying on the unfavourable surface of an old snowpack on rather lightly snow-covered shady slopes. Is lying on a crust on steep south, west and southeast facing slopes. In some cases the wind slabs have bonded still only poorly with the old snowpack.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: As a consequence of falling temperatures, the natural avalanche activity will rapidly decrease.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Wet avalanches as the day progresses.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
The mostly small wind slabs of the weekend can be released by a single winter sport participant in isolated cases. This applies in particular in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain in particular at intermediate and high altitudes.
As a consequence of warming during the day, the likelihood of moist and wet avalanches being released will increase in particular on steep sunny slopes. The new snow and wind slabs of the weekend can be released naturally especially on steep sunny slopes.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
In some places new snow and wind slabs are lying on the smooth surface of an old snowpack. This applies especially at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions, along the border with France.
Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise from early morning to increasing moistening of the snowpack in some places on sunny slopes. Sunny slopes: As a consequence of sharply rising temperatures and solar radiation a crust will form on the surface during the next few days.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation the avalanche prone locations will become more prevalent as the day progresses.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
As a consequence of warming during the day and the solar radiation, the likelihood of moist and wet avalanches being released will increase gradually in particular on steep slopes.
Several medium-sized and, in isolated cases, large avalanches are possible in the regions with a lot of snow.
The fresh snow of the weekend as well as the sometimes deep wind slabs can be released, especially by large additional loads,.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
The weather conditions as the day progresses will give rise to increasing moistening of the snowpack.
In particular on sunny slopes below approximately 1600 m a little snow is lying on south facing slopes.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation the avalanche prone locations will become more prevalent as the day progresses.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
As a consequence of warming during the day and the solar radiation, the likelihood of moist and wet avalanches being released will increase gradually in particular on steep slopes.
Several medium-sized and, in isolated cases, large avalanches are possible in the regions with a lot of snow.
The fresh snow of the weekend as well as the sometimes deep wind slabs can be released, especially by large additional loads,.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
The weather conditions as the day progresses will give rise to increasing moistening of the snowpack.
Weak layers exist in the snowpack.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The danger of moist avalanches will increase during the day.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: The danger of wet and gliding avalanches will increase during the day. Below approximately 2600 m small and, in isolated cases, medium-sized moist and wet avalanches are possible. The sometimes strong wind has transported some snow. The wind slabs have formed in particular adjacent to ridgelines and in the high Alpine regions. The fresh wind slabs can be released by small loads. The new snow of the last few days is very loosely bonded in particular on shady slopes above approximately 2000 m.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: The new snow of the last few days is very loosely bonded in particular on shady slopes above approximately 2100 m. The snowpack is largely stable; its surface consists of loosely bonded snow. The high temperatures as the day progresses will give rise to increasing moistening of the snowpack in particular on very steep sunny slopes.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: In some localities increase in danger of moist avalanches as a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation. The avalanche danger will increase but remain within the current danger level.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: New snow at high altitude.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: As a consequence of new snow and wind individual mostly small avalanches are possible above approximately 1700 m. This applies especially in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain, as well as on very steep slopes.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: The old snowpack remains subject to considerable local variations. At intermediate altitudes only a little snow is lying. At high altitude mostly small wind slabs formed. In gullies and bowls the wind slabs are larger. The small quantity of fresh snow of the last few days and the mostly small wind slabs are lying on top of a favourable old snowpack above approximately 1700 m.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: As the day progresses wet snow slides and avalanches are to be expected. Wind slabs require caution.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation small moist snow slides and avalanches are to be expected. This applies in particular on steep sunny slopes. The avalanche danger will increase a little during the day.

Wind slabs can be released in isolated cases, but mostly only by large additional loads, on very steep shady slopes above approximately 2400 m, especially adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas. Mostly avalanches are only small.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to increasing softening of the snowpack over a wide area.

Wind slabs are in individual cases still prone to triggering in particular on steep shady slopes, especially adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls.

At low and intermediate altitudes only a little snow is now lying.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: As the day progresses wet snow slides and avalanches are to be expected.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: As the day progresses wet snow slides and avalanches are to be expected. Wind slabs require caution.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation small moist snow slides and avalanches are to be expected. This applies in particular on steep sunny slopes. The avalanche danger will increase a little during the day.

Wind slabs can be released in isolated cases, but mostly only by large additional loads, on very steep shady slopes above approximately 2400 m, especially adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas. Mostly avalanches are only small.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to increasing softening of the snowpack over a wide area.

Wind slabs are in individual cases still prone to triggering in particular on steep shady slopes, especially adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls.

At low and intermediate altitudes only a little snow is now lying.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: As the day progresses wet snow slides and avalanches are to be expected.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The snowpack will be generally well bonded.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Individual avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular on steep shady slopes. Small avalanches are possible.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: A little snow is lying.
